title: Fantastic

renewed-issues.note: Issue number as given in issue.  Renewal record gives the issue number of the August 1954 issue as 5, but this is a typographical error.

renewed-contributions.title: Sin of Hyacinth Pence
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given in renewal record.  FictionMags gives title as 'The Sin of Hyacinth Peuch'.  We have not examined the issue in question.

Issue as given in renewal record.  FictionMags does not report a story with this title, or with this author, in this issue, but does report one in the January-February 1953 issue. We have not examined the issues in question.
renewed-contributions.title: Isle of Blight

renewed-contributions.note: Issue as given in FictionMags for this story.  The renewal record for this story reports it appearing in the November-December 1952 issue. We have not examined the issues in question.
renewed-contributions.title: Isle of Blight
By These Presents
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given in copyright renewal record, a separate record from the record giving the title above.  FictionMags reports the only story by Kuttner in this issue to be 'Satan Sends Flowers'.  ISFDB reports 'By These Presents' as a variant title for the story titled 'Satan Sends Flowers'.

renewed-contributions.title: Johnny Pye and the Fool Killer
renewed-contributions.note: While there was no renewal filed for this reprinting of the story, there is an active copyright renewal for its first publication, in the September 18, 1937 issue of the Saturday Evening Post.

renewed-contributions.title: A Great Day for the Amorous
Mother by Protest
renewed-contributions.note: A renewal record for 'Trespass a.k.a. Mother by Protest' by Matheson says that it ran in the September-October 1953 issue of Fantastic Story magazine.  There is no such issue of that magazine, and the closest match we can find to the story designation is this story in this issue.

renewed-contributions.title: Mourners for Hire
renewed-contributions.note: Renewal record also gives additional title 'We Mourn for Anyone'.

renewed-contributions.title: Coffin Run
renewed-contributions.note: Renewal record says that it appears in the August 1957 issue of Fantastic Universe, but it actually ran in the August 1957 issue of this magazine.

renewed-contributions.title: March of the Yellow Death
renewed-contributions.note: Renewal record also gives additional title 'Battle Accommodations'.

renewed-contributions.title: If This be Utopia
renewed-contributions.note: Renewal record also gives additional title 'The Rarest Rareie'.

renewed-contributions.title: Pot-Luck Genii
renewed-contributions.note: Renewal record also gives additional title 'A Genie Can Be Hell'.

renewed-contributions.title: Revolt of the Shadows
renewed-contributions.note: Renewal record also gives additional title 'The Shadow Revolt'.

renewed-contributions.title: The Lavendar Talent
renewed-contributions.note: Title as spelled in online renewal record.  FictionMags gives title as 'The Lavender Talent'. We have not examined the issue in question.

renewed-contributions.title: Suicide World
renewed-contributions.note: Renewal record also gives additional title 'Waste'.

renewed-contributions.title: Who Stole My Mind?
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given in online renewal record.  FictionMags gives title as 'Who Steals My Mind...'.  We have not examined the issue in question.

renewed-contributions.title: What Crouches in the Deep?
renewed-contributions.note: Online renewal record is for a group of contributions, including this one, credited to Arthur and Irwin Porges.  FictionMags credits only Arthur for this contribution.

renewed-contributions.title: The Worth of Man
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given in online renewal record. FictionMags gives title as 'The Worth of a Man'.  We have not examined the issue in question.

renewed-contributions.title: The Forerunner
renewed-contributions.note: Online renewal record is for a group of contributions, including this one, credited to Arthur and Irwin Porges.  FictionMags credits only Arthur for this contribution.

renewed-contributions.title: The Shakespeare Manuscript
renewed-contributions.note: Online renewal record is for a group of contributions, including this one, credited to Arthur and Irwin Porges.  FictionMags credits only Arthur for this contribution.

renewed-contributions.title: The Priests of Psi
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given on issue cover. CCE renewal record gives title as 'Priest of Psi'.

Introduction to 'The Mother' by David H. Keller
Introduction to 'To Heaven Standing Up' by Paul Ernst

Introduction to 'Non-Stop to Mars' by Jack Williamson
Introduction to 'The Past Master' by Robert Bloch
renewed-contributions.note: Issue as designated in online CCE renewal record.  However, FictionMags places 'The Past Master' in the June 1962 issue rather than the May 1962 issue, so this introduction might have appeared there instead. We have not examined the issues in question.

renewed-contributions.title: Introduction to 'The Past Master' by Robert Bloch
renewed-contributions.note: This is the issue in which 'The Past Master' appeared, according to FictionMags, so it might be where this introduction appeared, despite the designation in its online CCE renewal record.  We have not examined the issues in question.

In the Days of King Arsgrat

The Screams of the Wergs
renewed-contributions.note: Author name is a pseudonym for John Jakes.

He That Hath Wings
renewed-contributions.note: Issue designation as given in renewal record.  FictionMags does not report a piece with this title, or by Disch, in this issue, but such a story does appear in the July 1963 issue.

renewed-contributions.title: Introduction to 'He That Hath Wings' by Edmond Hamilton
He That Hath Wings
renewed-contributions.note: A story with this title and author is mentioned on the cover of this issue, and in FictionMags.  The renewal record for this story in the registered works database says it instead appeared in the June 1963 issue, but this appears to be incorrect.

renewed-contributions.title: Introduction to 'The Devil in Hollywood' by Dale Clarke
Sometimes I Get So Happy
renewed-contributions.note: Title as spelled in FictionMags.  Online renewal record gives title as 'SometimesI Get So Happy'. We have not examined the issue in question.

renewed-contributions.title: Introduction to 'The Singing Sands of Prester John' by H. B. Jones
Introduction to 'The Wolf Woman' by H. Bedford Jones
I, I, I Was a Spider for the SBI
A Thesis on Social Form and Social Control in the US
renewed-contributions.note: Issue designation as given in renewal record.  FictionMags does not report a piece with this title, or by Disch, in this issue, but does report 'A Thesis on Social Forms and Social Controls in the U.S.A.' by Disch appearing in the January 1964 issue.

renewed-contributions.title: After a Judgement Day
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given on issue cover. CCE renewal record gives title as 'After a Judgement'.

renewed-contributions.title: A Thesis on Social Forms and Social Controls in the U.S.A.
renewed-contributions.note: Title and issue designation as given in FictionMags.  The copyright renewal database records a 1991 renewal for a similarly-titled work by Disch in the November 1963 issue of Fantastic that we have not been able to locate there.  The renewal might cover this piece, however.  The January 1964 issue was published and copyrighted in late 1963.

renewed-contributions.title: They Never Come Back from Whoosh!

additional-note: Some issues of this magazine included reprints.  We have not systematically checked whether the original publications of those reprinted stories have active renewals. Check the table of contents listings linked from here for issue(s) you plan to use, to see if any reprints are indicated, and then check for renewals of the original publications.
acknowledgement: Thanks to Scott Andrews for copyright research on this title.
